name: Pella de gofio
description: /'Ball of toasted flour'/ This dessert, like gofio, comes from the amazigh tribes that inhabited the Canary Islands before the colonization. It's traditionally used to complement meals.

ingredients: Water (16 g with 8 g honey or 18 g with 5 g sugar)

instructions: Mix together, form balls and cut in slices.
variants: Add finely ground almonds, palm honey, honey, fresh white cheese, raisings...

serving: Decorate with leaves of spearmint (hierbabuena in Spain, hierbahuerto in the Canaries), honey, palm honey, nuts, raisins...
